text: <http://picnic.design/>

attachments.title: Picnic Plugin for Sketch
attachments.text: Picnic is a Sketch plugin for working together in a single file.

text: Currently in private alpha, but something we should keep our eyes out for
that would be amazing
hey all, a reminder that we're meeting with renee this afternoon, and her portfolio site is linked above
Sounds great. I haven’t been in a group interview here yet, how do they normally work? Will you be leading the discussion, Megan and we’ll pop in with supporting questions?
Or is this a more informal “get to know each other” session
good question - I've met her once already for a first pass at getting to know her, and looked for high level skills matching our need
this meeting is about two things: giving you all the same opportunity to get acquainted
and two, taking a look at her skills
and is this for a full time UX team member?
there will be one more group interviewing her for general fit with uncorked
Or just contracting for a specific project?
we are flexible right now
We think we need two people
and the need on care is immediate, and google is potentially needing resources any time
we're open to full time or contract
I personally prefer to work with someone on a contract basis so we all know what we're getting into if we offer a full time job, but that can be hard to do if someone has to leave an existing job
In renee's case, I believe she is currently freelance, and available but still supporting some other freelance projects on a limited basis
Gotcha, that makes sense
<http://markwyner.com/>

attachments.title: Mark Wyner - UX/UI Designer in Portland, Oregon
attachments.text: The virtual studio of Mark Wyner—creative professional specializing in UX, IA, ideation, UI design/development, and research, in the spaces of web, mobile, wearables, IoT, and connected cars. Portrait by Dan Hawk Photography (<http://danhawk.com|danhawk.com>).
attachments.fallback: Mark Wyner: Mark Wyner - UX/UI Designer in Portland, Oregon
